events.originalText: Russian statesman and politician Boris Nemtsov, an outspoken critic of Vladimir Putin, was assassinated in central Moscow.
events.subtitle: Boris Nemtsov
events.headline: Boris Nemtsov Assassinated in Central Moscow

events.originalText: Violent riots, perceived to have been instigated by a train fire that killed 59 Hindu pilgrims, broke out in the Indian state of Gujarat, killing at least 1,000 people, mostly Muslims, over three days.
events.subtitle: 2002 Gujarat riots
events.headline: Violent Riots Erupt in Gujarat, India

events.originalText: The multimedia franchise Pokémon was launched with the release of the video games Pocket Monsters: Red and Green.
events.subtitle: Media franchise
events.headline: Pokémon Franchise Launched with Red and Green Games

events.originalText: A wave of protests, riots and looting known as the Caracazo resulted in a death toll of between 276 and 2,000 people in the Venezuelan capital Caracas and its surrounding towns.
events.subtitle: Caracazo
events.headline: Caracazo Protests Result in Hundreds Dead in Caracas

events.originalText: The Armenian community of Sumgait in Azerbaijan was the target of a violent pogrom.
events.subtitle: Sumgait
events.headline: Armenian Community Targeted in Sumgait Pogrom

events.originalText: The D'Oyly Carte Opera Company, known for its performances of Gilbert and Sullivan's Savoy operas, gave its final performance.
events.subtitle: D'Oyly Carte Opera Company
events.headline: D'Oyly Carte Opera Company Gives Final Performance

events.originalText: The Sunday People revealed that the notorious pornographer James Humphreys had bribed a senior London police officer with a holiday to Cyprus and Beirut.
events.subtitle: The Sunday People
events.headline: Notorious Pornographer Bribes London Police Officer

events.originalText: Two dissident Republic of Vietnam Air Force pilots bombed the Independence Palace in Saigon in a failed attempt to assassinate President Ngo Dinh Diem.
events.subtitle: South Vietnam Air Force
events.headline: Failed Assassination Attempt on President Ngo Dinh Diem

events.originalText: American biochemists Martin Kamen and Sam Ruben discovered carbon-14, a radioactive isotope of carbon, which is now used extensively as the basis of the radiocarbon dating method to date archaeological and geological samples.
events.subtitle: Martin Kamen
events.headline: Biochemists Discover Carbon-14 Isotope

events.originalText: The Reichstag building, the seat of the German parliament in Berlin, was set on fire in a pivotal event in the establishment of the Nazi regime.
events.subtitle: Reichstag building
events.headline: Reichstag Building Set on Fire in Berlin

events.originalText: FC Bayern Munich, Germany's most successful football club, was founded.
events.subtitle: FC Bayern Munich
events.headline: FC Bayern Munich Founded

events.originalText: During the First Boer War, the British suffer a disastrious defeat at Majbua Hill
events.subtitle: First Boer War
events.headline: British Suffer Defeat at Majuba Hill

events.originalText: The current flag of Japan was first adopted as a civil ensign for Japanese merchant ships.
events.subtitle: Flag of Japan
events.headline: Japan Adopts Current Flag as Civil Ensign

events.originalText: American Revolutionary War: A Patriot victory at the Battle of Moore's Creek Bridge resulted in the arrests of 850 Loyalists over the following days.
events.subtitle: American Revolutionary War
events.headline: Patriot Victory at Battle of Moore's Creek Bridge

events.originalText: Sweden signed the Treaty of Stolbovo to end the Ingrian War with Russia, making large territorial gains.
events.subtitle: Treaty of Stolbovo
events.headline: Sweden Signs Treaty of Stolbovo to End Ingrian War

events.originalText: The Treaty of Berwick was signed, setting the terms under which an English fleet and army could enter Scotland to expel French troops defending the regency of Mary of Guise (pictured).
events.subtitle: Treaty of Berwick (1560)
events.headline: Treaty of Berwick Signed to Expel French Troops from Scotland
